required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sequential CD19 and CD22 CAR-T Therapy for Newly Diagnosed Ph+ B-ALL
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial for the Safety and Efficacy of Sequential CD19 and CD22 CAR-T Therapy for Adult Patients With Newly Diagnosed Ph Chromosome Positive B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical Trial for the Safety and Efficacy of Sequential CD19 and CD22 CAR-T Therapy for Adult Patients With Newly Diagnosed Ph Chromosome Positive B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, single arm study. To evaluate the safety and efficacy of sequential CD19 and CD22 CAR-T cells in the treatment of adult newly diagnosed Ph chromosome positive B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia. The main endpoints were dose limiting toxicity (DLT) and incidence of adverse events (TEAEs).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 28 days after CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Remission Rate after CAR-T cell therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of CD19 CAR-T cells to death or the last visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the complete remission to the occurrence of any event, including death, relapse (any one occurs first), and the last visit

Assessment using European Organisation for the Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) scale [For item1-28: max score: 112, min score: 28, higher scores mean a better outcome; for item 28-29: max score: 14, min score: 2, higher scores mean a worse outcome] to measure Quality of life at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

arm_group.description: Administration of CD19 and CD22 CAR T-cells

intervention.intervention_name: CAR-T cells targeting CD19 and CD22
intervention.description: Each subject receives sequential CD19 and CD22 CAR-T cells by intravenous infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Ageâ‰¥15 years old; Newly diagnosed B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia according to the 2016 WHO classification; The immunophenotype of leukemia cells were CD19 and CD22 positive; Ph- or Ph- like negative; Anticipated survival time more than 12 weeks; Those who voluntarily participated in this trial and provided informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
History of craniocerebral trauma, conscious disturbance, epilepsy, cerebrovascular ischemia, and cerebrovascular hemorrhagic diseases; Electrocardiogram shows prolonged QT interval, severe heart diseases such as severe arrhythmia in the past; Pregnant (or lactating) women; Patients with severe active infections (excluding simple urinary tract infection and bacterial pharyngitis); Active infection of hepatitis B virus or hepatitis C virus; Concurrent therapy with systemic steroids within 2 weeks prior to screening, except for the patients recently or currently receiving inhaled steroids; Previously treated with any CAR-T cell product or other genetically-modified T cell therapies; Creatinine>2.5mg/dl, or ALT / AST > 3 times of normal amounts, or bilirubin>2.0 mg/dl; Other uncontrolled diseases that were not suitable for this trial; Patients with HIV infection; Any situations that the investigator believes may increase the risk of patients or interfere with the results of study.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital, College of Medicine, Zhejiang University
